meanings.definition: To focus one's attention or energy on something again.
meanings.sent1: After getting distracted, she started refocussing on her homework.
meanings.sent2: He refocussed on his goals after a brief setback.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept refocussing on the moving laser pointer, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: She refocussed her mind like a camera lens, sharpening her concentration.
meanings.sent5: Refocussing on the task at hand, he blocked out all distractions.

meanings.definition: To adjust the focus of a camera or other optical device again.
meanings.sent1: The photographer was refocussing the lens to capture a clearer image.
meanings.sent2: He refocussed the binoculars to get a better view of the distant mountains.
meanings.sent3: The camera kept refocussing on the wrong object, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: She refocussed the telescope, revealing the beauty of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Refocussing the microscope, he discovered tiny details previously unseen.
